com.example.rest

Class PhonebookRest

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.rest.PhonebookRest

  • @Path(value="/phonebook")
public class PhonebookRest
extends java.lang.Object
    This class works as the main REST API to handle request to work with 'bulk Persons data'. (Also Contains example methods how to interact with the REST API and operations for different data types). The 'URL' is specified further in 'web.xml' if needed. The full url path will be (for example): <protocol>://<host>/<war_name_in_pom.xml >/<rest_path_in_web.xml>/<@Path_in_this_class>
    The url path to this REST API is:
    http://localhost:8080/jeer/rest/phonebook
    To handle operations per person, use PersonRest.

    • Method Detail

      • getAllPersons

        @GET
@Consumes(value="application/json")
@Produces(value="application/json")
public Response getAllPersons(@QueryParam(value="param")
                                           java.lang.String value)
        This will respond to GET request with dataType : 'json' & "Content-Type" : "application/json".
        Will get a listing of all persons in the database
        Parameters:
        value - An url parameter (?param=xxx) that will be mapped to method parameter (you need to provide the annotation @QueryParam(value = "param") to pick this up)
        Returns:
        A Response object stating how things went
        See Also:
        PersonRest.getPerson(String, String), PersonRest.addPerson(JsonObject)

      • updatePersons

        @PUT
@Consumes(value="application/json")
@Produces(value="application/json")
public Response updatePersons(javax.json.JsonArray arr)
        This will respond to PUT request with dataType : 'json' & "Content-Type" : "application/json".
        Will update the provided list of person entities in database.
        Parameters:
        arr - A json array containing all the information needed to update a list of persons. You may have any kind of structure when you iterate the content manually, but it is easier if you have the same structure that the serialized entity will have. The structure for each object should be equal to what got with 'getPerson'
        Returns:
        A Response object stating how things went
        See Also:
        PersonRest.getPerson(String, String), PersonRest.addPerson(JsonObject)

        @GET
